title: LANDS END / DEPOT DOOR
description: The door to the jammed supply depot near Land's End. The door is jammed and locked. You can't open it. EVER.

dialogueTree.title: Door (Unopenable): "An old door, worn by elements, guar..."
dialogueTree.text: An old door, worn by elements, guards the depot. The wind has blown a sand dune in front of it. The door hasn't been opened in a long while. You see a handle.

links.title: You: "What is this thing anyway?"
links.text: What is this thing anyway?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's military -- a service depot o..."
links.text: "It's military -- a service depot of some sort."

links.title: You: ""Used to service what?""
links.text: "Used to service what?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Probably something that is no long..."
links.text: "Probably something that is no longer there." The lieutenant looks at the hunching, concrete toad in front of him.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It may have been used to service an..."
links.text: It may have been used to service an aerostatic battleship in the atmosphere? Or a fortification, like a seafort in the bay.

links.title: Door (Unopenable): "The concrete structure looks *milit..."
links.text: The concrete structure looks *military* in origin. Over half a century old at least, but sturdily built.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "For servicing an aerostatic battles..."
links.text: For servicing an aerostatic battleship in the atmosphere? Or a fortification, like a seafort in the bay?

links.title: You: ""Could this structure have been use..."
links.text: "Could this structure have been used to take the shot?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""From here to the Whirling? I can't..."
links.text: "From here to the Whirling? I can't see how..." He looks southeast and blows on his fingers: "The church is in the way."

links.title: You: "Open the door."
links.text: Open the door.

links.title: Door (Unopenable): "There is no success. You didn't suc..."
links.text: There is no success. You didn't succeed here. It's impossible. The door does not open. It is not only locked, it is *jammed* shut.

links.title: You: "Huh... I wonder what's inside. How..."
links.text: Huh... I wonder what's inside. How can I get in there?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant shrugs. "We don't ge..."
links.text: The lieutenant shrugs. "We don't get in there."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean? We get into... l..."
links.text: "What do you mean? We get into... like... everywhere."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Frankly, you're just going to have..."
links.text: "Frankly, you're just going to have to accept the fact that you can't get in through every single door."

links.title: Rhetoric: "No-no, we've gotten into every door..."
links.text: No-no, we've gotten into every door thus far. That's what we do -- we open doors. We're cops, that's our perk. Even Evrart knew that's a part of our M.O.

links.title: You: ""But that's who I am. Who *we* are.""
links.text: "But that's who I am. Who *we* are."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yeah, I understand you, I like ope..."
links.text: "Yeah, I understand you, I like opening doors as much as the next guy, but this one is simply beyond repair and we don't have the resources needed to open it."

links.title: You: ""I'm not gonna accept this. The doo..."
links.text: "I'm not gonna accept this. The door could be part of the investigation."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Relax. No one's hiding in there. I..."
links.text: "Relax. No one's hiding in there. If we can't open it, others can't either -- and thus they can't get in." He looks at the door with a rueful smile.

links.title: Conceptualization: "At least you can *think* about open..."
links.text: At least you can *think* about opening it. About doors in general -- they are, after all, fundamental to your life. Perhaps something useful will come from this?

links.title: You: ""Okay. I can live with this." (Acce..."
links.text: "Okay. I can live with this." (Accept it.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What else is there to do? *Not* ac..."
links.text: "What else is there to do? *Not* accepting isn't gonna bring the fire brigade in..." He looks at the door with a rueful smile.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Relax, he thinks. There's no one in..."
links.text: Relax, he thinks. There's no one in there. If we can't open it, neither can anyone else.

links.title: Rhetoric: "No-no, we've absolutely gotten into..."
links.text: No-no, we've absolutely gotten into everywhere thus far. That's what we do -- we open doors and go through them. We're cops, that's our perk.

links.title: You: ""Come on, we even got in the Light..."
links.text: "Come on, we even got in the Light Bending Guy's container, but you're saying we can't get in here?"

links.title: Door (Unopenable): "You can't. This door cannot be open..."
links.text: You can't. This door cannot be opened...

links.title: Door (Unopenable): "EVER."
links.text: EVER.

links.title: Conceptualization: "At least you can *think* about open..."
links.text: At least you can *think* about opening it. About doors in general -- they are, after all, fundamental to your life. Perhaps something useful will come from this?

links.title: You: ""Whatever, door." [Leave.]"
links.text: "Whatever, door." [Leave.]

links.title: Door (Unopenable): "Yes. Better that way. You can't eve..."
links.text: Yes. Better that way. You can't even fathom the rabbit hole you might find yourself in otherwise.

links.title: Door (Unopenable): "You rattle the handle a bit, then p..."
links.text: You rattle the handle a bit, then push on the door with all your weight -- it does not budge. Not only is it locked, it's also *jammed* shut.

links.title: You: "Walk away. [Leave.]"
links.text: Walk away. [Leave.]
